thread.title: VOTE: EFL Goals of the Month
thread.title_full: VOTE: EFL Goals of the Month

title: VOTE: EFL Goals of the Month
text:
VOTE: Sky Bet EFL Goals of the Month for January in Championship, League One and League Two Last Updated: 09/02/17 3:57pm Who will win the award for the best goal of the month in each of the Sky Bet EFL leagues? Watch and vote for the best Sky Bet EFL Goals of the Month for January in the Championship, League One and League Two. 
The three leagues have kicked off 2017 with a bang, producing some stunning strikes as we hurtle towards the end of the season with fights for promotion, play-offs and relegation in full swing. 
But which goal was the best? Watch the videos of the three nominated strikes from each league and vote for your favourite. Voting closes at 6pm on Tuesday February 14. Championship Nominees for the Sky Bet Championship Goal of the Month award for January 2017, including strikes from Tom Lawrence, Souleymane Doukara and Ben Osborn 
Tom Lawrence (Preston 1-1 IPSWICH - January 28) 
There was an audible gasp when Lawrence picked the ball up on the left, jinked between two defenders and lifted his curling shot into the far corner. 
Souleymane Doukara (LEEDS 2-0 Nott'm Forest - January 25) 
A headed clearance dropped to Doukara. With impeccable technique and exquisite timing, he struck a volley so sweetly into the top corner, it almost broke the net. 
Ben Osborn (NOTT'M FOREST 1-0 Bristol City - January 21) 
Matthew Cash tapped back a free-kick, Osborn flicked it up with his left foot, then used it again to unleash a dipping 25-yard dipping volley over the wall. League One Nominees for the Sky Bet League One Goal of the Month award for January 2017, including strikes from Chuks Aneke, Josh Morris and Gregg Wylde 
Chuks Aneke (Peterborough 0-4 MK DONS - January 28) 
Collecting the ball outside the box, Aneke played a one-two with Paul Downing, strode on to the return pass and walloped a rasping drive into the top corner. 
Josh Morris (Northampton 1-2 SCUNTHORPE - January 14) 
On a Scunthorpe counter-attack, Morris knew exactly what to do. He picked up the ball in space, slipped it on to his left foot and curled home an unstoppable shot. 
Gregg Wylde (MK Dons 5-3 NORTHAMPTON - January 21) 
A case of adjusting your body to a dropping ball. A Northampton free-kick was cleared to Wylde, who chested it down beautifully before timing a sweet half-volley. League Two Nominees for the Sky Bet League Two Goal of the Month award for January 2017, including strikes from Shay McCartan, Gavin Massey and Dan Butler 
Shay McCartan (ACCRINGTON 1-1 Carlisle - January 21) 
Some free-kicks are just unstoppable. The only time McCartan's stunning 30-yarder was on target was in the final moments of its flight when it dipped wickedly under the bar. 
Gavin Massey (Portsmouth 2-1 LEYTON ORIENT - January 14) 
A game of head tennis ended when Nigel Atangana laid the ball off on the edge of the box for Massey to whip a majestic curling shot into the far corner. 
Dan Butler (NEWPORT 3-1 Hartlepool - January 28) 
Bouncing balls on muddy pitches are difficult to judge, but Butler did it perfectly, steadying himself to loop his shot effortlessly over a forest of bodies. 
The shortlist for the poll is decided by a judging panel following suggestions from supporters via Twitter. 
The judging panel comprises Sky Sports' EFL expert Don Goodman, Sky Bet sponsorship manager David Tweed and EFL head of marketing communications Andy Dodd. 
To suggest a goal to be considered for future Sky Bet Goal of the Month awards, fans can tweet details of their nominated goal to @SkyBet using #SkyBetGotM. Also See:
